body_html:
I think the issue is that ubuntu 14.04 has a lower version of GLIBC. When build moves to ubuntu 16.04, some of the GLIBC symbols that is linked on is not available for GLIBC in 14.04.

The easiest path for the fix might be to upgrade from 14.04 to ubuntu 16.04.

Otherwise I think you can try alternatives:

  1. Upgrade or install newer version of glibc on 14.04 (may typically cause some other issues on other software in your system, as glibc has a much bigger impact)
  2. Recompile TensorFlow from source on Ubuntu 14.04.
  3. Use docker to run inside the container.

Also if the build is run on Ubuntu 16.04 maybe the supported platform for binary install could be updated.

Recompile TensorFlow from source on Ubuntu 14.04.
Use docker to run inside the container.

Also if the build is run on Ubuntu 16.04 maybe the supported platform for binary install could be updated.
body:
I think the issue is that ubuntu 14.04 has a lower version of GLIBC. When build moves to ubuntu 16.04, some of the GLIBC symbols that is linked on is not available for GLIBC in 14.04.

The easiest path for the fix might be to upgrade from 14.04 to ubuntu 16.04.

Otherwise I think you can try alternatives:
1. Upgrade or install newer version of glibc on 14.04 (may typically cause some other issues on other software in your system, as glibc has a much bigger impact)
2. Recompile TensorFlow from source on Ubuntu 14.04.
3. Use docker to run inside the container.

Also if the build is run on Ubuntu 16.04 maybe the supported platform for binary install could be updated.
